title: Hoot (torpedo)
text:
The Hoot (; "Whale") is an Iranian <a href="supercavitation">supercavitation</a> <a href="torpedo">torpedo</a> claimed to travel at approximately , several times faster than a conventional torpedo. It was claimed to have been successfully test-fired from a surface ship against a dummy submarine during the Iranian military exercise "Great Prophet" () on 2 April 2006 and 3 April 2006. Iran test-fired the torpedo within its territorial waters in the <a href="Strait%20of%20Hormuz">Strait of Hormuz</a> in May 2017.
The official Iranian news agency <a href="Islamic%20Republic%20News%20Agency">IRNA</a> claims the torpedo was produced and developed by the <a href="Islamic%20Revolutionary%20Guard%20Corps">Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps</a> (). Most military and industry analysts have concluded that the Hoot is <a href="Reverse%20engineering%23Reverse%20engineering%20for%20military%20applications">reverse engineered</a> from the Russian <a href="VA-111%20Shkval">VA-111 Shkval</a> supercavitation torpedo which travels at the same speed.
